revised_title: Magnetic Disturbances and Terrestrial Galvanic Currents
tldr: The author examines the relationship between magnetic disturbances and terrestrial galvanic currents using data from the Royal Observatory of Greenwich. He finds a close agreement between the irregularities of the two phenomena, with galvanic irregularities usually preceding magnetic ones. The study also reveals a constant turn towards the north and a larger force towards the west in the galvanic currents.
